comment.author: 57099931@N05
comment._content: Sarsfield Bridge called after General Patrick Sarsfield ,Jacobite hero, was originally called Wellesley Bridge after Richard Marquis of Wellesley, a Lord Lieutenant of Ireland.Offically opened 1835.

comment.author: 57098752@N07
comment._content:
The plans for the bridge were drawn up by Alexander Nimmo. 
Nimmo modelled the bridge on the Pont Neiully in Paris. It had five arches and a swivel bridge.
It was opened 1835 and cost £89,061.
